Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (989) 758-2717.

ALLEGATION: Staff member has come to work under the influence of alcohol on
two occasions. On 8/6/22, staff member had a container of alcohol on facility
property. On 8/13/22, staff member was believed to be under the influence when
speaking inappropriately about personal use of weapons in front of youth.
INVESTIGATION:
Contact was made with the complaint on 08/17/2022. Additional information was
provided and is included in the context of this report.
A site visit was made on 08/18/2022. Staff 2 assisted in gathering documents and
less of who was in placement and had worked with Staff 1 in the past few weeks.
Information was also provided for a youth that might have information in regard to
Staff 1 that had recently been discharged from the program.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 08/17/2022. She confirmed that
she was Staff 1’s direct supervisor since his hire into the program. Supervisor 1
stated that the allegations came in directly from Youth A stating to a different staff
member that she thought Staff 1 might have been intoxicated while working the
weekend prior. Supervisor one also stated that she had statements from a couple
different staff in her own facility investigation, and those would be shared for this
investigation. Supervisor 1 stated that prior to the allegations contained in this
investigation, she had given discipline for Staff 1 because of poor work performance.
On Saturday 08/13/2022 Staff 1 reported to work late, clocked in, and essentially
disappeared for two hours. Supervisor one stated that Staff 1 had some attendance
issues, including being late on 08/12/2022.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 08/18/2022. She stated that she received a written
statement from Staff 7 from the weekend prior and provided this for this interview.
Staff 3 noted that after Staff 1 was sent home for the day on 08/13/2022, she found
a liquor bottle in the woods just passed the garden that matched the description from
what staff seven allegedly witnessed. In addition, Staff 2 found another liquor bottle
of the same variety on 08/17/2022 in a similar location. Pictures of these liquor
bottles have been provided for this investigation. It is alleged that Staff 1 threw
these liquor bottles into the woods after drinking while at work because of their
location near the parking lot where staff par. Staff 3 was asked more about her
experiences working with Staff 1. She stated that she had not been working with
him on the day that he was sent home, but that she would work with him on some
occasions on second shift. Staff 3 noted that she did not have any concerns directly
about Staff 1, but that she knew Staff 6 had some direct experience is that cause
concern and suggested she be interviewed.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 08/18/2022. She stated that on 08/15/2022 she was
approached by Staff 7 about something concerning that Staff 7 had seen over the
weekend. Staff 7 wanted to report this and handle the situation appropriately. Staff 7
3

was instructed to write a written statement because they would be off on leave very
soon. Staff 4 stated that she had not seen anything concerning regarding Staff 1’s
behavior at work overall, but that she reported everything she heard from Staff 7 to
Supervisor 1 immediately on 08/15/2022.
Youth A and Youth A’s parent were interviewed over the phone on 08/19/2022.
Youth A had recently been discharged from this facility on Monday 08/15/2022 and
moved back in with her mother. Youth A stated that the weekend before she
returned home, she thought that Staff 1 seemed intoxicated while at work. She
stated that she wasn’t sure if he was high or drunk, but that something was off.
When asked what made her say that, and what kind of things she noticed, she
stated that he was distant, nodding off, his eyes were bloodshot, his communication
was slow, and that he might have fallen asleep prior to taking the children to lunch.
Youth A did not have any previous concerns about Staff 1. Youth A was also asked
about the allegations that Staff 1 had been saying inappropriate things to the
children in regard to guns. Youth A denied ever hearing anything to that extent,
noting that Staff 1 was quiet and distant, but more so in a notable way and Saturday
08/13/2022.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 08/26/2022. The staff member is a human resource
professional within the facility and provided Staff 1's personnel file to be reviewed.
She confirmed that Staff 1 is currently on administrative leave pending an
investigation and provided an updated phone number for him. Staff 1 personnel file
was reviewed. He has worked at the facility since June 2022. There were no
discipline or training concerns located within the file. On 10/13/2022 Staff 5
confirmed that Staff 1’s employment had been terminated by the agency.
Staff 6 was interviewed on 08/26/2022. Staff 6 is a direct care worker and has
worked with the agency for approximately nine months. Staff 6 stated that she
started helping Staff 1 with rides to work a few weeks prior to his last day of
employment. The notable day that she wanted to share about was 08/13/2022. On
that Saturday Staff 6 picked up Staff 1 from his residence. Staff 6 recalls that Staff 1
came out to her car with a liquor bottle in his hand, and she saw his take at least two
drinks from it as he approached the car. Staff 6 stated that she told Staff 1 that he
shouldn’t have that and that she didn’t want him to have it in her car. Staff 1
allegedly told her not to worry about it and that he wouldn’t leave it in her car when
they got to work. Staff 6 confirmed that the bottle wasn’t in her car after they got to
the facility, so she assumed that Staff 1 took it in to work. Staff 6 noted that she
didn’t see Staff 1 until after 11 am after they had gotten to the facility to start their
shifts some hours earlier. Staff 6 recalled that she immediately informed supervision
of what occurred on the way to work with Staff 1 when she got to the facility. Staff 6
was asked to describe the size and color of the bottle and her description matched
what Staff 7 had in her written statement and matched the two bottles that other staff
had found in the woods near the staff parking lot in days after 08/13/2022.
4

Youth B, Youth C and Youth D were interviewed on 08/29/2022 at the facility.
Youth B stated that she remembers Staff 1 working there and wondered where he
had been. She stated that she didn’t have anything bad to say about Staff 1, but
also noted that he usually seemed tired all the time. Youth B remembers that Staff 1
smoked because she could smell it on him. Youth B does not recall hearing any
inappropriate comments from Staff 1 in regard to guns or a dangerous
neighborhood. Child’s C and D had similar statements in regard to not having
specific concerns about Staff 1 and not hearing inappropriate comments from him
either. Youth D did note that she thought Staff 1 was “nonchalant” and forgot a lot of
things, and that she felt like his eyes were always dilated.
A written statement dated 08/16/2022 by Staff 7 was received on 08/18/2022. Staff
7 was unavailable to be interviewed personally for this investigation because of a
pre-planned leave before it began. Staff 7’s written statement describes seeing Staff
1 near his car in where employees commonly park on 08/13/2022. Staff 7 stated
that she saw a small, clear liquor bottle in his hand and seeing him take sips from it
before he left the parking lot area and walked in to the woods that are located yards
from it. Staff 7 states that she did not see Staff 1 after that time.
Communication with Staff 1 was attempted on several occasions during this
investigation. Three different phone numbers were procured for him from other staff
at the facility. No contact was able to be made for him. The last attempt occurred on
09/01/2022 when an unknown individual answered a phone number provided for
Staff 1 and stated that it was not Staff 1’s phone number, but his, and he was a
coworker. This individual stated that he was going to ask Staff 1 to contact that this
investigator, but that never occurred.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Staff qualifications.
Rule 112. (1) A person with ongoing duties shall have both
of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: Through face-to-face visits at the facility, phone interviews as
well as documentation collected, it was found that evidence
existed to show that Staff 1 came to work under the influence
and brough alcohol to the facility.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the license remain unchanged upon acceptance of an
approved CAP.
